channel.title: Asides on Deuts Log
channel.description: Recent content in Asides on Deuts Log

item.title: @deuts@deuts.one 01JN347NEHWGR8D9RMESEZP4VJ
item.description: A lot of banks in the Philippines still rely on SMS for #2FA, despite how insecure it is—easily spoofed, intercepted, and unreliable. Some use in-app confirmations via their mobile app, but if you lose access to your phone, you’re probably locked out. Why not support standard authentication apps like #2FAS, #Aegis, #Bitwarden, #Vaultwarden, or #KeePassXC, which have TOTP support and easy backups? That way, I wouldn’t have to worry about losing access. #MFA #MultiFactorAuthentication #Security
item.content:encoded: A lot of banks in the Philippines still rely on SMS for #2FA, despite how insecure it is—easily spoofed, intercepted, and unreliable. Some use in-app confirmations via their mobile app, but if you lose access to your phone, you’re probably locked out. Why not support standard authentication apps like #2FAS, #Aegis, #Bitwarden, #Vaultwarden, or #KeePassXC, which have TOTP support and easy backups? That way, I wouldn’t have to worry about losing access. #MFA #MultiFactorAuthentication #Security

item.title: @deuts@deuts.one 01JN30AH41PJN423J80EDKBN8Y

item.title: @deuts@deuts.one 01JN2S09YR7GE3RTYWAYBQPE24
item.description: One good advantage of #GoToSocial is it accepts up to 5,000 characters toots/statuses/messages, compared to just 500 in #Mastodon (at least in my #FossTodon instance). I can post blog-like contents in here.
item.content:encoded: One good advantage of #GoToSocial is it accepts up to 5,000 characters toots/statuses/messages, compared to just 500 in #Mastodon (at least in my #FossTodon instance). I can post blog-like contents in here.

item.title: @deuts@deuts.one 01JN2RVW84HNMAR1620KS3G97H
item.description:
Received this email from #GreenCloudVPS:

We would like to inform you about an upcoming data center migration for our SG DC1. As of April 2025, our current SG DC1 upstream provider, Datacamp/CDN77, will cease operations at Digital Realty (formerly known as Cyxtera), the facility where our rack is currently located. As a result, we will be relocating our rack to a new upstream provider, xTom, at Global Switch Tai Seng.

The migration is scheduled to take place in mid-March 2025. During this process, we anticipate a service outage lasting approximately 12–24 hours. No data or IP addresses will be affected. We will provide the exact date and time in a follow-up email once confirmed.
item.content:encoded:
Received this email from #GreenCloudVPS:

We would like to inform you about an upcoming data center migration for our SG DC1. As of April 2025, our current SG DC1 upstream provider, Datacamp/CDN77, will cease operations at Digital Realty (formerly known as Cyxtera), the facility where our rack is currently located. As a result, we will be relocating our rack to a new upstream provider, xTom, at Global Switch Tai Seng.

The migration is scheduled to take place in mid-March 2025. During this process, we anticipate a service outage lasting approximately 12–24 hours. No data or IP addresses will be affected. We will provide the exact date and time in a follow-up email once confirmed.

I just hope this happens at night. This server is so important to me it runs several important scripts. And hopefully, the outage won’t take that long.

item.title: Track Changes Online with ChangeDetection, a Self-Hosted Docker Container! | Techno Tim
item.description:
Track Changes Online with ChangeDetection, a Self-Hosted Docker Container! | Techno Tim

Tracking things on the web just got a whole lot easier with ChangeDetection, the free and open source Docker container! Track website changes, price changes of products, and even track out of stock products with notifications all from a container you host yourself!
Our guide for running changedetection that worked.
item.content:encoded:
Track Changes Online with ChangeDetection, a Self-Hosted Docker Container! | Techno Tim

Tracking things on the web just got a whole lot easier with ChangeDetection, the free and open source Docker container! Track website changes, price changes of products, and even track out of stock products with notifications all from a container you host yourself!
Our guide for running changedetection that worked.

item.title: @deuts@deuts.one 01JMX92C9JR2Q1RN97Z0NX1VQB
item.description: Support for multiple domain names is in the roadmap for #PangolinTunnel. Hopefully it’ll be implemented soon. docs.fossorial.io/∞
item.content:encoded: Support for multiple domain names is in the roadmap for #PangolinTunnel. Hopefully it’ll be implemented soon. docs.fossorial.io/∞

item.title: @deuts@deuts.one 01JMVF13H2NYQ4J0J7H0Q9Q6P1
item.description:
#Kopia is great. At least it didn’t fail me so far. However, here are my gripes about it:

  1. You need to run separate instances if you want to use multiple repositories
  2. The cache and logs folders can bloat that they sometimes occupy significant server storage.
item.content:encoded:
#Kopia is great. At least it didn’t fail me so far. However, here are my gripes about it:

  1. You need to run separate instances if you want to use multiple repositories
  2. The cache and logs folders can bloat that they sometimes occupy significant server storage.

item.title: @deuts@deuts.one 01JMTZ4H9NMKZEKZCGBVT74FHK
item.description: It keeps me wondering, if I’m gonna install #PangolinTunnel, why not go directly with #CloudflareTunnel?
item.content:encoded: It keeps me wondering, if I’m gonna install #PangolinTunnel, why not go directly with #CloudflareTunnel?

item.title: @deuts@deuts.one 01JMTQZ33AJZZ7ZCCWX9NZR0XM
item.description: #Blinko now has a plugin system, and the first plugin available in the marketplace is my requested feature, a permalink to my notes! How cool is that?! github.com/∞
item.content:encoded: #Blinko now has a plugin system, and the first plugin available in the marketplace is my requested feature, a permalink to my notes! How cool is that?! github.com/∞
